Title: Board defines cyber security roles
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee defines clear roles and responsibilities for cyber security both within the board of directors or executive committee and broadly within their organisation.

Title: Board integrates cyber security across business
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee ensures that cyber security is integrated throughout all business functions within their organisation.

Title: Cyber strategy aligned with business strategy
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee ensures the cyber security strategy for their organisation is aligned with the overarching strategic direction and business strategy for their organisation.

Title: Board receives regular cyber posture briefings
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee seeks regular briefings or reporting on the cyber security posture of their organisation, as well as the threat environment in which they operate, from internal and external subject matter experts.

Title: Board champions positive cyber security culture
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee champions a positive cyber security culture within their organisation, including through leading by example.

Title: Board maintains cyber security literacy
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee maintains a sufficient level of cyber security literacy to fulfil both their fiduciary duties and any legislative or regulatory obligations.

Title: Board monitors cyber recruitment and skills gaps
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee maintains awareness of key cyber security recruitment activities, retention rates for cyber security personnel, and cyber security skills and experience gaps within their organisation.

Title: Board supports cyber security training for personnel
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee supports the development of cyber security skills and experience for all personnel via internal and external cyber security awareness raising and training opportunities.

Title: Board understands business-critical systems
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee understands the business criticality of their organisation’s systems, including at least a basic understanding of what exists, their value, where they reside, who has access, who might seek access, how they are protected, and how that protection is verified.

Title: Board plans for major cyber incidents
Description from ISM: The board of directors or executive committee plans for major cyber security incidents, including by participating in exercises, and understand their duties in relation to such cyber security incidents.

Title: CISO appointed for cyber leadership
Description from ISM: A CISO is appointed to provide cyber security leadership and guidance for their organisation (covering information technology and operational technology).

Title: CISO oversees cyber program and compliance
Description from ISM: The CISO oversees their organisation’s cyber security program and ensures their organisation’s compliance with cyber security policy, standards, regulations and legislation.

Title: CISO regularly updates cyber program
Description from ISM: The CISO regularly reviews and updates their organisation’s cyber security program to ensure its relevance in addressing cyber threats and harnessing business and cyber security opportunities.

Title: CISO maintains register of systems
Description from ISM: The CISO develops, implements, maintains and verifies on a regular basis a register of systems used by their organisation.

Title: CISO implements cyber KPIs and metrics
Description from ISM: The CISO implements cyber security measurement metrics and key performance indicators for their organisation.

Title: CISO runs cyber steering committee
Description from ISM: The CISO coordinates cyber security and business alignment through a cyber security steering committee or advisory board, comprising of key cyber security and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.

Title: CISO coordinates security risk management
Description from ISM: The CISO coordinates security risk management activities between cyber security and business teams.

Title: CISO reports to board on cyber matters
Description from ISM: The CISO regularly reports directly to their organisation’s board of directors or executive committee on cyber security matters.

Title: CISO reports to audit/risk/compliance committee
Description from ISM: The CISO regularly reports directly to their organisation’s audit, risk and compliance committee (or equivalent) on cyber security matters.

Title: CISO aware of all cyber incidents
Description from ISM: The CISO is fully aware of all cyber security incidents within their organisation.

Title: CISO oversees incident response
Description from ISM: The CISO oversees their organisation’s response to cyber security incidents.

Title: CISO contributes to business continuity planning and disaster recovery plans
Description from ISM: The CISO contributes to the development, implementation and maintenance of business continuity and disaster recovery plans for their organisation to ensure that business-critical services are supported appropriately in the event of a disaster.

Title: CISO oversees cyber communications strategy
Description from ISM: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of a cyber security communications strategy to assist in communicating the cyber security vision and strategy for their organisation.

Title: CISO manages cyber supply chain risk
Description from ISM: The CISO oversees cyber supply chain risk management activities for their organisation.

Title: CISO manages dedicated cyber budget
Description from ISM: The CISO receives and manages a dedicated cyber security budget for their organisation.

Title: CISO manages cyber personnel
Description from ISM: The CISO oversees the management of cyber security personnel within their organisation.

Title: CISO ensures sufficient cyber staffing
Description from ISM: The CISO ensures sufficient cyber security personnel, with the right skills and experience, are acquired to support cyber security activities within their organisation.

Title: CISO oversees cyber awareness training program
Description from ISM: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of their organisation’s cyber security awareness training program.

Title: Each system has an owner
Description from ISM: Each system has a designated system owner.

Title: System owners register systems with authorising officer
Description from ISM: System owners register each system with its authorising officer.

Title: System owners define boundary, criticality and objectives for systems
Description from ISM: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, determine the system boundary, business criticality and security objectives for each system based on an assessment of the impact if it were to be compromised.

Title: System owners conduct system threat & risk assessment
Description from ISM: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, conduct a threat and risk assessment for each system.

Title: System owners select and tailor controls
Description from ISM: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, select controls for each system and tailor them to achieve desired security objectives.

Title: System owners identify supplementary controls
Description from ISM: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, identify any supplementary controls required based upon the unique nature of each system, its operating environment and the organisation’s risk tolerances.

Title: System owners implement system controls
Description from ISM: System owners implement controls for each system and its operating environment.

Title: Systems (non-TS) undergo security assessment by IRAP/org assessors
Description from ISM: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, ensure controls for each non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET system and its operating environment undergo a security assessment by their organisation’s own assessors or Infosec Registered Assessor Program (IRAP) assessors to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.

Title: TOP SECRET systems assessed by ASD assessors
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, ensure controls for each TOP SECRET system and its operating environment, including each sensitive compartmented information system and its operating environment, undergo a security assessment by ASD assessors (or their delegates) to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.

Title: System owners obtain authorisation to operate (non-TS)
Description from ISM: System owners obtain authorisation to operate each non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET system from its authorising officer based on the acceptance of the security risks associated with its operation.

Title: Authorisation from Director-General ASD to operate TOP SECRET systems
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: System owners obtain authorisation to operate each TOP SECRET system, including each sensitive compartmented information system, from Director-General ASD (or their delegate) based on the acceptance of the security risks associated with its operation.

Title: System owners continuously monitor systems
Description from ISM: System owners monitor each system, and associated cyber threats, security risks and controls, on an ongoing basis.

Title: System owners implement data minimisation
Description from ISM: System owners implement and maintain data minimisation practices for each of their systems.

Title: System owners report security status at least annually
Description from ISM: System owners report the security status of each system to its authorising officer at least annually.

Title: Incident management policy and response plan maintained
Description from ISM: A cyber security incident management policy, and associated cyber security incident response plan, is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Incident management and response plan exercised at least annually
Description from ISM: The cyber security incident management policy, including the associated cyber security incident response plan, is exercised at least annually.

Title: Cyber incident register maintained
Description from ISM: A cyber security incident register is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Incident register records key incident details
Description from ISM:
A cyber security incident register contains the following for each cyber security incident:
• the date the cyber security incident occurred
• the date the cyber security incident was discovered
• a description of the cyber security incident
• any actions taken in response to the cyber security incident
• to whom the cyber security incident was reported.

Title: Insider threat mitigation program maintained
Description from ISM: An insider threat mitigation program is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Legal advice sought for insider threat mitigation program
Description from ISM: Legal advice is sought regarding the development and implementation of an insider threat mitigation program.

Title: Cyber personnel have adequate monitoring data/tools
Description from ISM: Cyber security personnel have access to sufficient data sources and tools to ensure that systems can be monitored for key indicators of compromise.

Title: Incidents reported to CISO promptly
Description from ISM: Cyber security incidents are reported to the chief information security officer, or one of their delegates, as soon as possible after they occur or are discovered.

Title: Incidents reported to ASD promptly
Description from ISM: Cyber security incidents are reported to ASD as soon as possible after they occur or are discovered.

Title: Customer-data incidents reported to customers/public
Description from ISM: Cyber security incidents that involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.

Title: Non-customer-data incidents reported to customers/public
Description from ISM: Cyber security incidents that do not involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.

Title: Incident response plan enacted after identification
Description from ISM: Following the identification of a cyber security incident, the cyber security incident response plan is enacted.

Title: Data owners advised and access restricted after data spill
Description from ISM: When a data spill occurs, data owners are advised and access to the data is restricted.

Title: Malicious code handling and remediation steps
Description from ISM:
When malicious code is detected, the following steps are taken to handle the infection:
• the infected systems are isolated
• all previously connected media used in the period leading up to the infection are scanned for signs of infection and isolated if necessary
• antivirus applications are used to remove the infection from infected systems and media
• if the infection cannot be reliably removed, systems are restored from a known good backup or rebuilt.

Title: Stored/communicated malicious code treated before use
Description from ISM: Malicious code, when stored or communicated, is treated beforehand to prevent accidental execution.

Title: Malicious code analysed in segregated environment
Description from ISM: Malicious code processed for cyber security incident response or research purposes is done so in a dedicated analysis environment that is segregated from other systems.

Title: Legal advice before allowing intrusion activity to continue
Description from ISM: Legal advice is sought before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.

Title: System owners consulted before allowing intrusion activity to continue
Description from ISM: System owners are consulted before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.

Title: Out-of-Band Intrusion Remediation Planning
Description from ISM: Planning and coordination of intrusion remediation activities are conducted on a separate system to that which has been compromised.

Title: Coordinate all intrusion remediation during planned outage
Description from ISM: To the extent possible, all intrusion remediation activities are conducted in a coordinated manner during the same planned outage.

Title: Post-remediation full network traffic capture & analysis
Description from ISM: Following intrusion remediation activities, full network traffic is captured for at least seven days and analysed to determine whether malicious actors have been successfully removed from the system.

Title: Investigators maintain evidence integrity
Description from ISM:
The integrity of evidence gathered during an investigation is maintained by investigators:
• recording all of their actions
• maintaining a proper chain of custody
• following all instructions provided by relevant law enforcement agencies.

Title: Suppliers of systems and services identified
Description from ISM: Suppliers of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services associated with systems are identified.

Title: Supplier supply chain risk assessment performed
Description from ISM: A supply chain risk assessment is performed for suppliers of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services in order to assess the impact to a system’s security risk profile.

Title: High-risk suppliers not used
Description from ISM: Suppliers identified as high risk by a cyber supply chain risk assessment are not used.

Title: Procure from security-focused suppliers
Description from ISM: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are procured from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to the security of their products and services.

Title: Procure from suppliers demonstrating transparency
Description from ISM: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are procured from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to transparency for their products and services.

Title: Procure from suppliers with strong systems security track record
Description from ISM: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are procured from suppliers that have a strong track record of maintaining the security of their own systems.

Title: Create shared responsibility model with suppliers
Description from ISM: A shared responsibility model is created, documented and shared between suppliers and their customers in order to articulate the security responsibilities of each party.

Title: Supplier relationship management policy maintained
Description from ISM: A supplier relationship management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Approved supplier list maintained
Description from ISM: An approved supplier list is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Source from approved suppliers
Description from ISM: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are sourced from approved suppliers.

Title: Identify multiple suppliers for critical systems
Description from ISM: Multiple potential suppliers are identified for sourcing critical operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services.

Title: Keep spares of critical IT/OT equipment
Description from ISM: Sufficient spares of critical IT equipment and OT equipment are sourced and kept in reserve.

Title: Supplies delivered maintaining integrity
Description from ISM: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are delivered in a manner that maintains their integrity.

Title: Assess integrity during product acceptance
Description from ISM: The integrity of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are assessed as part of acceptance of products and services.

Title: Assess authenticity during product acceptance
Description from ISM: The authenticity of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are assessed as part of acceptance of products and services.

Title: Managed service register maintained
Description from ISM: A managed service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Managed service register contains required details
Description from ISM:
A managed service register contains the following for each managed service:
• managed service provider’s name
• managed service’s name
• purpose for using the managed service
• sensitivity or classification of data involved
• due date for the next security assessment of the managed service
• contractual arrangements for the managed service
• point of contact for users of the managed service
• 24/7 contact details for the managed service provider.

Title: Managed services undergo IRAP assessment at least every 24 months
Description from ISM: Managed service providers and their non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET managed services undergo an Infosec Registered Assessor Program (IRAP) assessment, using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the IRAP assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.

Title: TOP SECRET managed services assessed by ASD at least every 24 months
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Managed service providers and their TOP SECRET managed services, including sensitive compartmented information managed services, undergo a security assessment by ASD assessors (or their delegates), using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the security assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.

Title: Outsourced cloud service register maintained
Description from ISM: An outsourced cloud service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Cloud register contains required cloud service details
Description from ISM:
An outsourced cloud service register contains the following for each outsourced cloud service:
• cloud service provider’s name
• cloud service’s name
• purpose for using the cloud service
• sensitivity or classification of data involved
• due date for the next security assessment of the cloud service
• contractual arrangements for the cloud service
• point of contact for users of the cloud service
• 24/7 contact details for the cloud service provider.

Title: Use private/community clouds for SECRET/TOP SECRET
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Only community or private clouds are used for outsourced SECRET and TOP SECRET cloud services.

Title: Cloud service providers and their services undergo IRAP assessment at least every 24 months
Description from ISM: Outsourced cloud service providers and their non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET cloud services undergo an IRAP assessment, using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the IRAP assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.

Title: TOP SECRET cloud services assessed by ASD at least every 24 months
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Outsourced cloud service providers and their TOP SECRET cloud services, including sensitive compartmented information cloud services, undergo a security assessment by ASD assessors (or their delegates), using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the security assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.

Title: Service providers protect entrusted data
Description from ISM: Service providers, including any subcontractors, provide an appropriate level of protection for any data entrusted to them or their services.

Title: Security requirements documented in provider contracts
Description from ISM: Security requirements associated with the confidentiality, integrity and availability of data are documented in contractual arrangements with service providers and reviewed on a regular and ongoing basis to ensure they remain fit for purpose.

Title: Right to verify compliance documented in provider contracts
Description from ISM: The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Right to verify compliance exercised regularly
Description from ISM: The right to verify compliance with security requirements documented in contractual arrangements with service providers is exercised on a regular and ongoing basis.

Title: Break clauses for security requirement failures in provider contracts
Description from ISM: Break clauses associated with failure to meet security requirements are documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Providers must report cyber incidents to designated contact
Description from ISM: The requirement for service providers to report cyber security incidents to a designated point of contact as soon as possible after they occur or are discovered is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: One-month notification period for provider changes
Description from ISM: A minimum notification period of one month by service providers for significant changes to their own service provider arrangements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Data types and ownership documented in provider contracts
Description from ISM: Types of data and its ownership is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Regions/availability zones and change notification period documented
Description from ISM: The regions or availability zones where data will be processed, stored and communicated, as well as a minimum notification period for any configuration changes, is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Access to logs documented in contracts
Description from ISM: Access to all logs relating to an organisation’s data and services is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Portable storage and backup/migration documented in contracts
Description from ISM: The storage of data in a portable manner that allows for backups, service migration and service decommissioning without any loss of data is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: One-month notification for service cessation documented
Description from ISM: A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

Title: Service providers only access systems under contract
Description from ISM: An organisation’s systems are not accessed or administered by a service provider unless a contractual arrangement exists between the organisation and the service provider to do so.

Title: Immediate notification for unauthorised provider access
Description from ISM: If an organisation’s systems are accessed or administered by a service provider in an unauthorised manner, the organisation is immediately notified.

Title: Cyber security strategy maintained
Description from ISM: A cyber security strategy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: CISO approves organisation-level cyber docs; AO approves system-specific cyber docs
Description from ISM: Organisational-level cyber security documentation is approved by the chief information security officer while system-specific cyber security documentation is approved by the system’s authorising officer.

Title: System security architecture approved pre-development
Description from ISM: A system’s security architecture is approved prior to the development of the system.

Title: Cyber documentation reviewed at least annually
Description from ISM: Cyber security documentation is reviewed at least annually and includes a ‘current as at [date]’ or equivalent statement.

Title: Cyber docs and changes communicated to all stakeholders
Description from ISM: Cyber security documentation, including notification of subsequent changes, is communicated to all stakeholders.

Title: System security plan includes system overview and controls annex
Description from ISM: Systems have a system security plan that includes an overview of the system (covering the system’s purpose, the system boundary and how the system is managed) as well as an annex that covers applicable controls from this document and any additional controls that have been identified and implemented.

Title: System cyber incident response plan contains required elements
Description from ISM:
Systems have a cyber security incident response plan that covers the following:
• guidelines on what constitutes a cyber security incident
• the types of cyber security incidents likely to be encountered and the expected response to each type
• how to report cyber security incidents, internally to an organisation and externally to relevant authorities
• other parties which need to be informed in the event of a cyber security incident
• the authority, or authorities, responsible for investigating and responding to cyber security incidents
• the criteria by which an investigation of a cyber security incident would be requested from a law enforcement agency, the Australian Signals Directorate or other relevant authority
• the steps necessary to ensure the integrity of evidence relating to a cyber security incident
• system contingency measures or a reference to such details if they are located in a separate document.

Title: Change & configuration management plan contains required elements
Description from ISM:
Systems have a change and configuration management plan that includes:
• the establishment and maintenance of authorised baseline configurations for systems
• what constitutes routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• how changes to the configuration of systems will be requested, tracked and documented
• who needs to be consulted prior to routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• who needs to approve routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• who needs to be notified of routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• what additional change management and configuration management processes and procedures need to be followed before, during and after routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems.

Title: Continuous monitoring plan with scanning and testing requirements
Description from ISM:
Systems have a continuous monitoring plan that includes:
• conducting vulnerability scans for systems at least fortnightly
• conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration tests for systems prior to deployment, including prior to deployment of significant changes, and at least annually thereafter
• analysing identified vulnerabilities to determine their potential impact
• implementing mitigations based on risk, effectiveness and cost.

Title: Security assessment report produced after assessment
Description from ISM:
At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a security assessment report is produced by the assessor and covers:
• the scope of the security assessment
• the system’s strengths and weaknesses
• security risks associated with the operation of the system
• the effectiveness of the implementation of controls
• any recommended remediation actions.

Title: Plan of action and milestones produced after assessment
Description from ISM: At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.

Title: Non-classified systems secured in suitable facilities
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to Non-classified
Description from ISM: Non-classified systems are secured in suitably secure facilities.

Title: Classified systems secured in suitable security-zone facilities
Description from ISM: Classified systems are secured in facilities that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.

Title: Non-classified IT and cryptographic equipment secured in rooms
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to Non-classified
Description from ISM: Non-classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in suitably secure server rooms or communications rooms.

Title: Classified IT and cryptographic equipment secured in rooms
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to Non-classified
Description from ISM: Classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in server rooms or communications rooms that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.

Title: Non-classified IT and cryptographic equipment secured in containers
Description from ISM: Non-classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in suitably secure security containers.

Title: Classified IT and cryptographic equipment secured in containers
Description from ISM: Classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in security containers suitable for their classification taking into account the combination of security zones they reside in.

Title: Server/communications rooms not left unsecured
Description from ISM: Server rooms, communications rooms and security containers are not left in unsecured states.

Title: Keys to secure rooms appropriately controlled
Description from ISM: Keys or equivalent access mechanisms to server rooms, communications rooms and security containers are appropriately controlled.

Title: Physical security protects network devices in public areas
Description from ISM: Physical security is implemented to protect network devices in public areas from physical damage or unauthorised access.

Title: Authorised RF/IR device register for SECRET/TOP SECRET areas maintained
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: An authorised RF and IR device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Unauthorised RF/IR devices banned in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Unauthorised RF and IR devices are not brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

Title: Detect/respond to unauthorised RF devices in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Security measures are used to detect and respond to unauthorised RF devices in SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

Title: Authorised photo/video device register maintained for SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: An authorised photographic and video recording device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Unauthorised photo/video devices banned in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Unauthorised photographic and video recording devices are not brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

Title: Authorised medical device register maintained for SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: An authorised medical device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Criteria for authorised medical devices in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM:
Medical devices that are authorised to be brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas meet, at a minimum, the following criteria:
• are listed on the Australian Register of Therapeutic Goods
• have been prescribed by a legally qualified medical practitioner
• have been commercially purchased within Australia
• do not have inbuilt cellular connectivity
• are capable of operating independently of mobile devices
• where possible, have Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and other forms of wireless connectivity disabled when operating within SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

Title: Unauthorised medical devices banned in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Unauthorised medical devices are not brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

Title: Prevent unauthorised observation of systems/displays
Description from ISM: Unauthorised people are prevented from observing systems, in particular workstation displays and keyboards, within facilities.

Title: Secure IT equipment and media when not in use
Description from ISM: IT equipment and media are secured when not in use.

Title: Annual cyber awareness training for all personnel
Description from ISM:
Cyber security awareness training is undertaken annually by all personnel and covers:
• the purpose of the cyber security awareness training
• security appointments and contacts
• authorised use of systems and their resources
• protection of systems and their resources
• reporting of cyber security incidents and suspected compromises of systems and their resources.

Title: Annual privileged user training
Description from ISM: Tailored privileged user training is undertaken annually by all privileged users.

Title: Cyber awareness training register maintained
Description from ISM: A cyber security awareness training register is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Banking/payment staff trained on business email compromise
Description from ISM: Personnel dealing with banking details and payment requests are advised of what business email compromise is, how to manage such situations and how to report it.

Title: User-account staff trained on social engineering
Description from ISM: Personnel dealing with user account details are advised of what social engineering attacks are, how to manage such situations and how to report them.

Title: Personnel trained to report suspicious online contact
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised of what suspicious contact via online services is and how to report it.

Title: Personnel avoid posting work info to unauthorised services
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised to not post work information to unauthorised online services and to report cases where such information is posted.

Title: Personnel maintain separate work and personal accounts
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised to maintain separate work and personal user accounts for online services.

Title: Personnel advised on personal info posting risks
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised of security risks associated with posting personal information to online services and are encouraged to use any available privacy settings to restrict who can view such information.

Title: Personnel not to send/receive files via unauthorised services
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised not to send or receive files via unauthorised online services.

Title: System usage policy maintained
Description from ISM: A system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: AI usage policy maintained
Description from ISM: A general-purpose artificial intelligence usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Web usage policy maintained
Description from ISM: A web usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Access requirements documented in system security plan
Description from ISM: Access requirements for systems and their resources are documented in their system security plan.

Title: Employment screening and clearances before granting access
Description from ISM: Personnel undergo appropriate employment screening and, where necessary, hold an appropriate security clearance before being granted access to systems and their resources.

Title: Personnel briefed before access granted
Description from ISM: Personnel receive any necessary briefings before being granted access to systems and their resources.

Title: Personnel agree to system usage policies before access
Description from ISM: Personnel agree to abide by system usage policies before being granted access to systems and their resources.

Title: Personnel granted access are uniquely identifiable
Description from ISM: Personnel granted access to systems and their resources are uniquely identifiable.

Title: Shared accounts strictly controlled and identifiable
Description from ISM: The use of shared user accounts is strictly controlled, and personnel using such accounts are uniquely identifiable.

Title: Contractor personnel identified as such
Description from ISM: Personnel who are contractors are identified as such.

Title: Foreign nationals identified for certain sensitive data access
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Where systems process, store or communicate AUSTEO, AGAO or REL data, personnel who are foreign nationals are identified as such, including by their specific nationality.

Title: Validate unprivileged access requests initially
Description from ISM: Requests for unprivileged access to systems and their resources are validated when first requested.

Title: Limit unprivileged access to required duties
Description from ISM: Unprivileged access to systems and their resources is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

Title: Log unprivileged access use centrally
Description from ISM: Use of unprivileged access is centrally logged.

Title: Foreign nationals restricted from AUSTEO/REL systems without effective controls
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Foreign nationals, including seconded foreign nationals, do not have access to systems that process, store or communicate AUSTEO or REL data unless effective controls are in place to ensure such data is not accessible to them.

Title: Foreign nationals restricted from AGAO systems without effective controls
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Foreign nationals, excluding seconded foreign nationals, do not have access to systems that process, store or communicate AGAO data unless effective controls are in place to ensure such data is not accessible to them.

Title: Validate privileged access requests initially
Description from ISM: Requests for privileged access to systems and their resources are validated when first requested.

Title: Limit privileged access to required duties
Description from ISM: Privileged access to systems and their resources is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

Title: Privileged accounts prevented from internet/email unless authorised
Description from ISM: Privileged user accounts (excluding those explicitly authorised to access online services) are prevented from accessing the internet, email and web services.

Title: Privileged accounts with internet access strictly limited
Description from ISM: Privileged user accounts explicitly authorised to access online services are strictly limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

Title: Use just-in-time administration for system administration
Description from ISM: Just-in-time administration is used for the administration of systems and their resources.

Title: Privileged users assigned dedicated privileged accounts
Description from ISM: Privileged users are assigned a dedicated privileged user account to be used solely for duties requiring privileged access.

Title: Unique privileged accounts used for server app administration
Description from ISM: Unique privileged user accounts are used for administering individual server applications.

Title: Privileged access events centrally logged
Description from ISM: Privileged access events are centrally logged.

Title: Privileged account/group management events centrally logged
Description from ISM: Privileged user account and security group management events are centrally logged.

Title: Foreign nationals restricted from privileged access to AUSTEO/REL
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Foreign nationals, including seconded foreign nationals, do not have privileged access to systems that process, store or communicate AUSTEO or REL data.

Title: Foreign nationals restricted from privileged access to AGAO
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Foreign nationals, excluding seconded foreign nationals, do not have privileged access to systems that process, store or communicate AGAO data.

Title: Same day removal/suspension of access when no longer required
Description from ISM: Access to systems and their resources are removed or suspended the same day personnel no longer have a legitimate requirement for access.

Title: Remove/suspend access when malicious activity detected
Description from ISM: Access to systems and their resources are removed or suspended as soon as practicable when personnel are detected undertaking malicious activities.

Title: Disable unprivileged access after 45 days inactivity
Description from ISM: Unprivileged access to systems and their resources are disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

Title: Disable privileged access after 45 days inactivity
Description from ISM: Privileged access to systems and their resources are disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

Title: Disable privileged access after 12 months unless revalidated
Description from ISM: Privileged access to systems and their resources are disabled after 12 months unless revalidated.

Title: Maintain secure user access record for the life of system and resources
Description from ISM:
A secure record is maintained for the life of systems and their resources that covers the following for each user:
• their user identification
• their signed agreement to abide by system usage policies
• who authorised their access
• when their access was granted
• the level of access they were granted
• when their access, and their level of access, was last reviewed
• when their level of access was changed, and to what extent (if applicable)
• when their access was withdrawn (if applicable).

Title: Temporary access to required data restricted by controls
Description from ISM: When personnel are granted temporary access to systems and their resources, effective controls are put in place to restrict their access to only data required for them to undertake their duties.

Title: Temporary access not granted for caveated/sensitive compartmented info
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Temporary access is not granted to systems that process, store or communicate caveated or sensitive compartmented information.

Title: Document and test emergency access method periodically
Description from ISM: A method of emergency access to systems and their resources is documented and tested at least once when initially implemented and each time fundamental information technology infrastructure changes occur.

Title: Break glass accounts only used when normal authentication impossible
Description from ISM: Break glass accounts are only used when normal authentication processes cannot be used.

Title: Break glass accounts limited to specific authorised activities
Description from ISM: Break glass accounts are only used for specific authorised activities.

Title: Change break glass credentials after use
Description from ISM: Break glass account credentials are changed by the account custodian after they are accessed by any other party.

Title: Test break glass accounts after credential change
Description from ISM: Break glass accounts are tested after credentials are changed.

Title: Log break glass account usage centrally
Description from ISM: Use of break glass accounts is centrally logged.

Title: AUSTEO/AGAO data under control of Australian national staff
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Systems processing, storing or communicating AUSTEO or AGAO data remain at all times under the control of an Australian national working for or on behalf of the Australian Government.

Title: AUSTEO/AGAO data accessed only from Australian Govt-controlled systems
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: AUSTEO and AGAO data can only be accessed from systems under the sole control of the Australian Government that are located within facilities authorised by the Australian Government.

Title: Cabling installed per Australian standards
Description from ISM: Cabling infrastructure is installed in accordance with relevant Australian Standards, as directed by the Australian Communications and Media Authority.

Title: Use fibre-optic cables instead of copper
Description from ISM: Fibre-optic cables are used for cabling infrastructure instead of copper cables.

Title: Cable register maintained
Description from ISM: A cable register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Cable register contains required cable details
Description from ISM:
A cable register contains the following for each cable:
• cable identifier
• cable colour
• sensitivity/classification
• source
• destination
• location
• seal numbers (if applicable).

Title: Floor plan diagrams maintained
Description from ISM: Floor plan diagrams are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

Title: Floor plans include cable and network details
Description from ISM:
Floor plan diagrams contain the following:
• cable paths (including ingress and egress points between floors)
• cable reticulation system and conduit paths
• floor concentration boxes
• wall outlet boxes
• network cabinets.

Title: Cable labelling processes maintained
Description from ISM: Cable labelling processes, and supporting cable labelling procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Cables labelled at each end for identification
Description from ISM: Cables are labelled at each end with sufficient source and destination details to enable the physical identification and inspection of the cable.

Title: Building management cables labelled with purpose
Description from ISM: Building management cables are labelled with their purpose in black writing on a yellow background, with a minimum size of 2.5 cm x 1 cm, and attached at five-metre intervals.

Title: Cables for foreign systems labelled at inspection points
Description from ISM: Cables for foreign systems installed in Australian facilities are labelled at inspection points.

Title: Consistent cable colours per system
Description from ISM: Cables for individual systems use a consistent colour.

Title: Non-secret cables not coloured salmon pink or red
Description from ISM: Non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED cables are coloured neither salmon pink nor red.

Title: SECRET cables coloured salmon pink
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET classification
Description from ISM: SECRET cables are coloured salmon pink.

Title: TOP SECRET cables coloured red
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: TOP SECRET cables are coloured red.

Title: Secret cables with non-conformant colouring banded and labelled
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: SECRET and TOP SECRET cables with non-conformant cable colouring are banded with the appropriate colour and labelled at inspection points.

Title: Cables in non-TS areas inspectable every 5m or less
Description from ISM: Cables in non-TOP SECRET areas are inspectable every five metres or less.

Title: TOP SECRET cables fully inspectable
Description from ISM: Cables in TOP SECRET areas are fully inspectable for their entire length.

Title: SECRET cables run in dedicated bundles/conduit
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET classification
Description from ISM: SECRET cables, when bundled together or run in conduit, are run exclusively in their own individual cable bundle or conduit.

Title: TOP SECRET cables run in dedicated bundles/conduit
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: TOP SECRET cables, when bundled together or run in conduit, are run exclusively in their own individual cable bundle or conduit.

Title: Partition/gap between cable bundles/conduits
Description from ISM: Cable bundles or conduits sharing a common cable reticulation system have a dividing partition or visible gap between each cable bundle and conduit.

Title: Shared facilities use enclosed reticulation systems
Description from ISM: In shared facilities, cables are run in an enclosed cable reticulation system.

Title: Clear plastic conduits/trays in shared facilities
Description from ISM: In shared facilities, conduits or the front covers of ducts, cable trays in floors and ceilings, and associated fittings are clear plastic.

Title: Use SCEC-approved tamper-evident seals on TOP SECRET covers
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: In shared facilities, uniquely identifiable SCEC-approved tamper-evident seals are used to seal all removable covers on TOP SECRET cable reticulation systems.

Title: Use conduit glue smear on TOP SECRET conduit joints
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: In shared facilities, a visible smear of conduit glue is used to seal all plastic conduit joints and TOP SECRET conduits connected by threaded lock nuts.

Title: TOP SECRET conduit labels meet requirements
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: Labels for TOP SECRET conduits are a minimum size of 2.5 cm x 1 cm, attached at five-metre intervals and marked as ‘TS RUN’.

Title: Cables to wall outlet boxes run in flexible/plastic conduit
Description from ISM: Cables from cable trays to wall outlet boxes are run in flexible or plastic conduit.

Title: TOP SECRET cables not run in party walls in shared facilities
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: In shared facilities, TOP SECRET cables are not run in party walls.

Title: TOP SECRET conduit sealing at wall penetrations
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: Where wall penetrations exit a TOP SECRET area into a lower classified area, TOP SECRET cables are encased in conduit with all gaps between the TOP SECRET conduit and the wall filled with an appropriate sealing compound.

Title: SECRET/TOP Wall outlet boxes contain only SECRET/TOP SECRET cables
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: SECRET and TOP SECRET wall outlet boxes contain exclusively SECRET or TOP SECRET cables.

Title: Wall outlet boxes denote system and cable identifiers
Description from ISM: Wall outlet boxes denote the systems, cable identifiers and wall outlet box identifier.

Title: Wall outlet boxes use consistent colours per system
Description from ISM: Wall outlet boxes for individual systems use a consistent colour.

Title: Non-secret outlet boxes not salmon pink or red
Description from ISM: Non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED wall outlet boxes are coloured neither salmon pink nor red.

Title: SECRET wall outlet boxes are salmon pink
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET classification
Description from ISM: SECRET wall outlet boxes are coloured salmon pink.

Title: TOP SECRET wall outlet boxes are red
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: TOP SECRET wall outlet boxes are coloured red.

Title: Wall outlet box covers are clear plastic
Description from ISM: Wall outlet box covers are clear plastic.

Title: TOP SECRET fiber fly leads protected and labelled
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: If TOP SECRET fibre-optic fly leads exceeding five metres in length are used to connect wall outlet boxes to IT equipment, they are run in a protective and easily inspected pathway that is clearly labelled at the IT equipment end with the wall outlet box’s identifier.

Title: Cable reticulation systems terminated close to cabinets
Description from ISM: Cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets are terminated as close as possible to the cabinet.

Title: TOP SECRET reticulation systems terminated close to cabinets
Description from ISM: In TOP SECRET areas, cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets in server rooms or communications rooms are terminated as close as possible to the cabinet.

Title: TOP SECRET reticulation systems terminated at cabinet boundary
Description from ISM: In TOP SECRET areas, cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets not in server rooms or communications rooms are terminated at the boundary of the cabinet.

Title: SECRET cables terminated in individual cabinet or segregated
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET classification
Description from ISM: SECRET cables are terminated in an individual cabinet; or for small systems, a cabinet with a division plate between any SECRET cables and non-SECRET cables.

Title: TOP SECRET cables terminated in individual cabinet
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: TOP SECRET cables are terminated in an individual TOP SECRET cabinet.

Title: Secret/Top Secret cables terminated on individual patch panels
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: SECRET and TOP SECRET cables are terminated on their own individual patch panels.

Title: TOP SECRET patch panels in individual cabinets
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: TOP SECRET patch panels are installed in individual TOP SECRET cabinets.

Title: Spatial constraints require physical barriers & controls for mixed cabinets
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM:
Where spatial constraints demand non-TOP SECRET patch panels be installed in the same cabinet as a TOP SECRET patch panel:
• a physical barrier in the cabinet is provided to separate patch panels
• only personnel holding a Positive Vetting security clearance have access to the cabinet
• approval from the TOP SECRET system’s authorising officer is obtained prior to installation.

Title: Visible gap between TOP SECRET and non-TOP SECRET cabinets
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: A visible gap exists between TOP SECRET cabinets and non-TOP SECRET cabinets.

Title: Consult ASIO when penetrating TOP SECRET audio secure rooms
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: When penetrating a TOP SECRET audio secure room, the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation is consulted and all directions provided are complied with.

Title: TOP SECRET IT equipment powered via UPS-fed distribution board
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to TOP SECRET classification
Description from ISM: A power distribution board with a feed from an Uninterruptible Power Supply is used to power all TOP SECRET IT equipment.

Title: IT equipment meets EMI/EMC standards
Description from ISM: IT equipment meets industry and government standards relating to electromagnetic interference/electromagnetic compatibility.

Title: Comply with ASD emanation security doctrine
Description from ISM: Emanation security doctrine produced by ASD for the management of emanation security matters is complied with.

Title: Contact ASD for TEMPEST threat assessment for SECRET/TOP SECRET
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: System owners deploying SECRET or TOP SECRET systems within fixed facilities contact ASD for an emanation security threat assessment.

Title: Contact ASD for TEMPEST when deploying mobile/deployable SECRET/TOP SECRET systems
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: System owners deploying SECRET or TOP SECRET systems in mobile platforms, or as a deployable capability, contact ASD for an emanation security threat assessment.

Title: Seek emanation security threat assessment early in system lifecycle
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: When an emanation security threat assessment is required, it is sought as early as possible in a system’s life cycle.

Title: Implement TEMPEST recommended actions
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Recommended actions contained within TEMPEST requirements statements issued for systems are implemented by system owners.

Title: Telephone system usage policy maintained
Description from ISM: A telephone system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Personnel advised of permitted sensitivity over phone
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised of the permitted sensitivity or classification of information that can be discussed over internal and external telephone systems.

Title: Personnel aware of non-secure telephone risks
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised of security risks posed by non-secure telephone systems in areas where sensitive or classified conversations can occur.

Title: Cryptographic equipment indicates connection types
Description from ISM: When using cryptographic equipment to permit different levels of conversation for different kinds of connections, telephone systems give a visual indication of what kind of connection has been made.

Title: Encrypt telephone traffic over external systems
Description from ISM: Telephone systems used for sensitive or classified conversations encrypt all traffic that passes over external systems.

Title: Do not use unencrypted cordless phones for sensitive conversations
Description from ISM: Cordless telephone handsets and headsets are not used for sensitive or classified conversations unless all communications are encrypted.

Title: Speakerphones restricted in TOP SECRET areas
Description from ISM: Speakerphones are not used on telephone systems in TOP SECRET areas unless the telephone system is located in an audio secure room, the room is audio secure during conversations and only personnel involved in conversations are present in the room.

Title: Use off-hook audio protection where background conversation levels exceed classification
Description from ISM: Off-hook audio protection features are used on telephone systems in areas where background conversations may exceed the sensitivity or classification that the telephone system is authorised for communicating.

Title: Use push-to-talk handsets in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas
Description from ISM: In SECRET and TOP SECRET areas, push-to-talk handsets or push-to-talk headsets are used to meet any off-hook audio protection requirements.

Title: Video conferencing/IP telephony hardened
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Video conferencing and IP telephony infrastructure is hardened.

Title: Use video-aware/voice-aware firewall/proxy for conferencing gateways
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: When video conferencing or IP telephony traffic passes through a gateway containing a firewall or proxy, a video-aware or voice-aware firewall or proxy is used.

Title: Use secure SIP for conferencing/IP telephony
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Video conferencing and IP telephony calls are established using a secure session initiation protocol.

Title: Use secure RTP for conferencing/IP telephony
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Video conferencing and IP telephony calls are conducted using a secure real-time transport protocol.

Title: Use encrypted non-replayable two-way call authentication
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: An encrypted and non-replayable two-way authentication scheme is used for call authentication and authorisation.

Title: Authenticate/authorize all actions on video conferencing network
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Authentication and authorisation is used for all actions on a video conferencing network, including call setup and changing settings.

Title: Authenticate/authorize all actions on IP telephony network
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Authentication and authorisation is used for all actions on an IP telephony network, including registering a new IP phone, changing phone users, changing settings and accessing voicemail.

Title: IP telephony configured with secure registration and limited functions
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM:
IP telephony is configured such that:
• IP phones authenticate themselves to the call controller upon registration
• auto-registration is disabled and only authorised devices are allowed to access the network
• unauthorised devices are blocked by default
• all unused and prohibited functionality is disabled.

Title: Individual logins for IP phones used for SECRET/TOP SECRET
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP / Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Individual logins are implemented for IP phones used for SECRET or TOP SECRET conversations.

Title: Separate conferencing/telephony traffic from other data
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Video conferencing and IP telephony traffic is separated physically or logically from other data traffic.

Title: Workstations not connected to conferencing/IP phones without VLAN separation
Non Applicability Rationale: No VOIP
Description from ISM: Workstations are not connected to video conferencing units or IP phones unless the workstation or the device uses Virtual Local Area Networks or similar mechanisms to maintain separation between video conferencing, IP telephony and other data traffic.

Title: Public-area IP phones restricted from data/network access
Description from ISM: IP phones used in public areas do not have the ability to access data networks, voicemail and directory services.

Title: Microphones/webcams not used with non-SECRET workstations in SECRET areas
Description from ISM: Microphones (including headsets and USB handsets) and webcams are not used with non-SECRET workstations in SECRET areas.

Title: Microphones/webcams not used with non-TOP SECRET workstations in TOP SECRET areas
Description from ISM: Microphones (including headsets and USB handsets) and webcams are not used with non-TOP SECRET workstations in TOP SECRET areas.

Title: Denial-of-service plan for conferencing/IP telephony maintained
Description from ISM: A denial of service response plan for video conferencing and IP telephony services is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: DOS plan contains detection, source identification, continuity and response actions
Description from ISM:
A denial of service response plan for video conferencing and IP telephony services contains the following:
• how to identify signs of a denial-of-service attack
• how to identify the source of a denial-of-service attack
• how capabilities can be maintained during a denial-of-service attack
• what actions can be taken to respond to a denial-of-service attack.

Title: MFD usage policy maintained
Description from ISM: An MFD usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: MFDs not connected to digital telephone systems
Description from ISM: MFDs are not connected to digital telephone systems.

Title: Authenticate to MFDs before print/scan/copy
Description from ISM: Users authenticate to MFDs before they can print, scan or copy documents.

Title: MFD authentication strength equals connected network workstations
Description from ISM: Authentication measures for MFDs are the same strength as those used for workstations on networks they are connected to.

Title: MFDs not used for high sensitivity scanning/copying
Description from ISM: MFDs are not used to scan or copy documents above the sensitivity or classification of networks they are connected to.

Title: MFD print/scan/copy actions centrally logged
Description from ISM: Use of MFDs for printing, scanning and copying purposes, including the capture of shadow copies of documents, are centrally logged.

Title: MFDs located where use can be observed
Description from ISM: MFDs are located in areas where their use can be observed.

Title: Do not use fax or online fax services
Description from ISM: Fax machines, and online fax services, are not used for sending or receiving fax messages.

Title: Seek legal advice before allowing private devices access
Description from ISM: Legal advice is sought prior to allowing privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers to access systems or data.

Title: Enforce separation of classified and personal data on private devices
Description from ISM: Personnel accessing OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data using privately-owned mobile devices or desktop computers have enforced separation of classified data from personal data.

Title: Prevent storage of classified data on private devices
Description from ISM: Personnel accessing OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data using privately-owned mobile devices or desktop computers are prevented from storing classified data on their privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers.

Title: Private devices do not access SECRET/TOP SECRET systems
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers do not access SECRET and TOP SECRET systems or data.

Title: Enforce separation of classified data on org-owned devices
Description from ISM: Personnel accessing systems or data using an organisation-owned mobile device or desktop computer have enforced separation of classified data from personal data.

Title: VPN to org gateway for internet access from devices
Description from ISM: Mobile devices and desktop computers access the internet via a VPN connection to an organisation’s internet gateway rather than via a direct connection to the internet.

Title: Disable split tunnelling for VPNs
Description from ISM: When accessing an organisation’s network via a VPN connection, split tunnelling is disabled.

Title: Mobile device management policy maintained
Description from ISM: A mobile device management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: MDM solutions have completed a CC evaluation against the PP MDM (v4.0 or later)
Description from ISM: Mobile Device Management solutions that have completed a Common Criteria evaluation against the Protection Profile for Mobile Device Management, version 4.0 or later, are used to enforce mobile device management policy.

Title: Use evaluated mobile platforms and follow ASD configs
Description from ISM: Mobile devices that access OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data use mobile platforms that have completed a Common Criteria evaluation against the Protection Profile for Mobile Device Fundamentals, version 3.3 or later, and are operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated ASD security configuration guide.

Title: SECRET/TOP SECRET mobile devices use ASD-approved platforms and operate in accordance to associated ASCI
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Mobile devices that access SECRET or TOP SECRET systems or data use mobile platforms that have been issued an Approval for Use by ASD and are operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated Australian Communications Security Instruction.

Title: Mobile devices encrypt internal storage/removable media
Description from ISM: Mobile devices encrypt their internal storage and any removable media.

Title: SECRET/TOP SECRET mobile devices restrict removable media
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices do not use removable media unless approved beforehand by ASD.

Title: Mobile devices encrypt sensitive/classified data over public networks
Description from ISM: Mobile devices encrypt all sensitive or classified data communicated over public network infrastructure.

Title: Mobile devices operated in supervised mode
Description from ISM: Mobile devices are configured to operate in a supervised (or equivalent) mode.

Title: Mobile devices have remote locate & wipe
Description from ISM: Mobile devices are configured with remote locate and wipe functionality.

Title: Mobile devices have secure lock screens
Description from ISM: Mobile devices are configured with secure lock screens.

Title: Prevent installation of non-approved apps on mobile devices
Description from ISM: Mobile devices prevent personnel from installing non-approved applications once provisioned.

Title: Prevent disabling/modifying security on mobile devices
Description from ISM: Mobile devices prevent personnel from disabling or modifying security functionality once provisioned.

Title: Apply security updates to mobile devices promptly
Description from ISM: Security updates are applied to mobile devices as soon as they become available.

Title: Mobile device usage policy maintained
Description from ISM: A mobile device usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Personnel advised of permitted sensitivity for mobile communications
Description from ISM: Personnel are advised of the sensitivity or classification permitted for voice and data communications when using mobile devices.

Title: Mobile device travel precautions and hygiene guidance
Description from ISM:
Personnel are advised to take the following precautions when using mobile devices:
• never leave mobile devices or removable media unattended, including by placing them in checked-in luggage or leaving them in hotel safes
• never store credentials with mobile devices that they grant access to, such as in laptop computer bags
• never lend mobile devices or removable media to untrusted people, even if briefly
• never allow untrusted people to connect their mobile devices or removable media to your mobile devices, including for charging
• never connect mobile devices to designated charging stations or wall outlet charging ports
• never use gifted or unauthorised peripherals, chargers or removable media with mobile devices
• never use removable media for data transfers or backups that have not been checked for malicious code beforehand
• avoid reuse of removable media once used with other parties’ systems or mobile devices
• avoid connecting mobile devices to open or untrusted Wi-Fi networks
• consider disabling any communications capabilities of mobile devices when not in use, such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Near Field Communication and ultra-wideband
• consider periodically rebooting mobile devices
• consider using a VPN connection to encrypt all cellular and wireless communications
• consider using encrypted email or messaging apps for all communications.

Title: Do not use SMS/MMS/pagers/messaging apps for sensitive data
Description from ISM: Paging, Multimedia Message Service, Short Message Service and messaging apps are not used to communicate sensitive or classified data.

Title: Non-classified mobile devices remain undiscoverable except pairing
Description from ISM: Non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices are configured to remain undiscoverable to other Bluetooth devices except during Bluetooth pairing.

Title: Bluetooth pairing uses Secure Connections/Numeric Comparison
Description from ISM: Bluetooth pairing for non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices is performed using Secure Connections, preferably with Numeric Comparison if supported.

Title: Bluetooth pairing limited to intended devices
Description from ISM: Bluetooth pairing for non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices is performed in a manner such that connections are only made between intended Bluetooth devices.

Title: Remove Bluetooth pairings when no longer required
Description from ISM: Bluetooth pairings for non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices are removed when there is no longer a requirement for their use.

Title: Disable Bluetooth on SECRET/TOP SECRET devices
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Bluetooth functionality is not enabled on SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices.

Title: Avoid viewing sensitive data on mobile devices in public
Description from ISM: Sensitive or classified data is not viewed on mobile devices in public locations unless care is taken to reduce the chance of the screen of a mobile device being observed.

Title: Apply privacy filters on SECRET/TOP SECRET device screens
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Privacy filters are applied to the screens of SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices.

Title: Avoid sensitive calls in public without precautions
Description from ISM: Sensitive or classified phone calls and conversations are not conducted in public locations unless care is taken to reduce the chance of conversations being overheard.

Title: Keep mobile devices under direct supervision when used
Description from ISM: Mobile devices are kept under continual direct supervision when being actively used.

Title: Carry/store mobile devices in secured state when not used
Description from ISM: Mobile devices are carried or stored in a secured state when not being actively used.

Title: If unable to secure, transfer devices in approved secure containers
