Description from ISM: CDSs are implemented between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and any other networks belonging to different security domains.

Title: Consult ASD before adding connectivity to CDSs
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: When planning, designing, implementing or introducing additional connectivity to CDSs, ASD is consulted and any directions provided by ASD are complied with.

Title: CDSs implement isolated upward and downward network paths
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: CDSs implement isolated upward and downward network paths.

Title: CDSs implement independent security-enforcing functions for upward/downward paths
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: CDSs implement independent security-enforcing functions for upward and downward network paths.

Title: CDSs implement protocol breaks at each network layer
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: CDSs implement protocol breaks at each network layer.

Title: Log CDS security-relevant events centrally
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Security-relevant events for CDSs are centrally logged.

Title: Quarterly sample taken of security events & assess CDS data-transfer events against policies
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: A sample of security-relevant events relating to data transfer policies are taken at least every three months and assessed against security policies for CDSs to identify any operational failures.

Title: Train users on secure CDS use before granting access
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Users are trained on the secure use of CDSs before access is granted.

Title: Use evaluated firewalls between organisation networks and public infrastructure
Description from ISM: Evaluated firewalls are used between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

Title: Use evaluated firewalls between different security domains
Description from ISM: Evaluated firewalls are used between networks belonging to different security domains.

Title: With WAF avoid exposing origin server IP addresses and restrict access to WAF/authorised management networks
Description from ISM: If using a WAF, disclosing the IP addresses of web servers under an organisation’s control (referred to as origin servers) is avoided and access to the origin servers is restricted to the WAF and authorised management networks.

Title: Use evaluated diodes for unidirectional gateways to public infrastructure
Description from ISM: Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

Title: High-assurance evaluated diodes for SECRET/TOP SECRET unidirectional gateways
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Evaluated diodes used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and public network infrastructure complete a high assurance evaluation.

Title: Use evaluated diodes for unidirectional inter-network gateways
Description from ISM: Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between networks.

Title: High-assurance evaluated diodes for SECRET/TOP SECRET inter-network gateways
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Evaluated diodes used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and any other networks complete a high assurance evaluation.

Title: Route all web access through web proxies
Description from ISM: All web access, including that by internal servers, is conducted through web proxies.

Title: Log web proxy access: URL, time, user, data volumes, internal/external IPs centrally
Description from ISM:
The following details are centrally logged for websites accessed via web proxies:
• web address
• date and time
• user
• amount of data uploaded and downloaded
• internal and external IP addresses.

Title: Implement web content filtering for harmful content
Description from ISM: Web content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful web-based content.

Title: Restrict client-side active content to approved domains via web filters
Description from ISM: Client-side active content is restricted by web content filters to an organisation-approved list of domain names.

Title: Apply web content filtering to outbound traffic where appropriate
Description from ISM: Web content filtering is applied to outbound web traffic where appropriate.

Title: Decrypt and inspect TLS traffic through gateways
Description from ISM: TLS traffic communicated through gateways is decrypted and inspected.

Title: Use an organisation-approved domain list for HTTP/HTTPS traffic through gateways
Description from ISM: An organisation-approved list of domain names, or list of website categories, is implemented for all Hypertext Transfer Protocol and Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure traffic communicated through gateways.

Title: Block malicious, dynamic and anonymously-registrable domains with web filters
Description from ISM: Malicious domain names, dynamic domain names and domain names that can be registered anonymously for free are blocked by web content filters.

Title: Block website access by IP address to prevent domain bypass
Description from ISM: Attempts to access websites through their IP addresses instead of their domain names are blocked by web content filters.

Title: Files transferred via gateways/CDSs undergo content-filtering
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content filtering checks.

Title: Block malicious or uninspectable files identified by content filters
Description from ISM: Files identified by content filtering checks as malicious, or that cannot be inspected, are blocked.

Title: Quarantine suspicious files pending review and approval
Description from ISM: Files identified by content filtering checks as suspicious are quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.

Title: Rigorously test CDS content filters to ensure they cannot be bypassed
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Content filters used by CDSs undergo rigorous security testing to ensure they perform as expected and cannot be bypassed.

Title: Decrypt encrypted files for content filtering at gateways/CDSs
Description from ISM: Encrypted files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are decrypted in order to undergo content filtering checks.

Title: Unpack archive files for content filtering at gateways/CDSs
Description from ISM: Archive files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are unpacked in order to undergo content filtering checks.

Title: Unpack archives in a controlled manner to preserve filter performance or availability
Description from ISM: Archive files are unpacked in a controlled manner to ensure content filter performance or availability is not adversely affected.

Title: Scan transferred files via gateway/CDS with multiple antivirus scanning engines
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo antivirus scanning using multiple different scanning engines.

Title: Automatically execute transferred executables via gateway/CDS in sandbox for behaviour analysis
Description from ISM: Executable files imported via gateways or CDSs are automatically executed in a sandbox to detect any suspicious behaviour.

Title: Filter transferred files by allowed types at gateways/CDSs
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are filtered for allowed file types.

Title: Perform content validation on transferred files via gateway/CDS
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content validation.

Title: Perform content checking on transferred files via gateway/CDS
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content checking.

Title: Perform content conversion for transferred files via gateway/CDS as needed
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content conversion.

Title: Sanitise content of transferred files via gateway/CDS
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content sanitisation.

Title: Validate digital signatures and checksums on transferred files via gateway/CDS
Description from ISM: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs that have a digital signature or cryptographic checksum are validated.

Title: Use evaluated peripheral switches when sharing peripherals between systems
Description from ISM: Evaluated peripheral switches are used when sharing peripherals between systems.

Title: Peripheral switches for SECRET/TOP SECRET sharing complete high-assurance evaluations
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Evaluated peripheral switches used for sharing peripherals between SECRET and TOP SECRET systems, or between SECRET or TOP SECRET systems belonging to different security domains, preferably complete a high assurance evaluation.

Title: Peripheral switches for cross-classified sharing complete high-assurance evaluations
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Evaluated peripheral switches used for sharing peripherals between SECRET or TOP SECRET systems and any non-SECRET or TOP SECRET systems complete a high assurance evaluation.

Title: Maintain data transfer processes and procedures
Description from ISM: Data transfer processes, and supporting data transfer procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

Title: Prevent export of AUSTEO/AGAO/REL data to unsuitable foreign systems
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Processes, and supporting procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained to prevent AUSTEO, AGAO and REL data in textual and non-textual formats from being exported to unsuitable foreign systems.

Title: Hold users accountable for their data transfers
Description from ISM: Users transferring data to and from systems are held accountable for data transfers they perform.

Title: Scan manually imported data for malicious or active content
Description from ISM: When manually importing data to systems, the data is scanned for malicious and active content.

Title: Quarantine manual imports that fail security checks
Description from ISM: When manually importing data to systems, all data that fails security checks is quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.

Title: Require review and authorisation before exporting SECRET/TOP SECRET data
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Data exported from SECRET and TOP SECRET systems is reviewed and authorised by a trustworthy source beforehand.

Title: Trustworthy source digitally signs authorised SECRET/TOP SECRET exports
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Data authorised for export from SECRET and TOP SECRET systems is digitally signed by a trustworthy source.

Title: Limit trustworthy export sources to CISO-verified entities for SECRET/TOP SECRET systems
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Trustworthy sources for SECRET and TOP SECRET systems are limited to people and services that have been verified and authorised as such by the chief information security officer.

Title: Check for unsuitable protective markings before manual export
Description from ISM: When manually exporting data from systems, the data is checked for unsuitable protective markings.

Title: Validate signatures & perform keyword checks on manual SECRET/TOP SECRET system exports
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: When manually exporting data from SECRET and TOP SECRET systems, digital signatures are validated and keyword checks are performed within all textual data.

Title: Quarantine manual exports that fail security checks pending review
Description from ISM: When manually exporting data from systems, all data that fails security checks is quarantined until reviewed and subsequently approved or not approved for release.

Title: Record all data imports and exports in data transfer logs
Description from ISM: Data transfer logs are used to record all data imports and exports from systems.

Title: Partially verify data transfer logs at least monthly
Description from ISM: Data transfer logs for systems are partially verified at least monthly.

Title: Fully verify SECRET/TOP SECRET data transfer logs at least monthly
Non Applicability Rationale: Protected classification; Control only applicable to SECRET and TOP SECRET classifications
Description from ISM: Data transfer logs for SECRET and TOP SECRET systems are fully verified at least monthly.
